result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Kabke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid from 25% of prision wages in accordance with prison policy.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions to be set as deemed appropriate by DOC.
Concurrent with: Winnebago Case #10CF577

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas A Kabke in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:05 PM.  State here for change of plea and sentencing, recites agreement charge 1 plead to as alleged, Ct. 4 & 9 DRI. Asking for 6 years, 6 months with 18 months of initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision, court costs. State will be arguing for cosecutive to Winnebago case #10CF577, Richards will be arguing for a concurrent sentence. Court dismisses counts 4 & 9. Kabke pleads G to count #1. Court has PLQ and goes over it with Kabke, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to JT. Court finds factual basis and accepts G plea to count #1. State makes final argument and asks court to follow joint recommendation but argues for 18 months to run consecutive to current sentence. Richards makes final argument and asks court to follow joint recommendation but asks 18 months to run concurrent, also asks for early release programs. Kabke makes statement, remorseful. Richards indicates 126 days jail credit. Court sentences Kabke to the following: Ct. 1 - Imposes defendant to the WI State Prision System 7 years, 2 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision concurrent Winnebago case 10CF577, will give 126 days credit, will grant eligible for earned release programs, no conditions on extended supervision, will leave up to DOC, costs to be paid within 25% of prision wages, DNA sample (expunction rights given), appeal rights, voting and firearm restrictions given.
Final pre-trial on June 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:31 PM. State - been advised by counsel that the defendant is currently in Dodge Correctional and need to reschedule the matter. Richardson agrees. Court orders State to prepare writ, continues bond, set for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Thomas A Kabke, in custody, in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:12 PM. Called 16CF42 and 16CF54. State - here for PH on both matters, however 16CF42 encompasses charges in 16CF54, so State moves to dismiss case 16CF42. Court dismisses case 16CF42 and releases from bond conditions in that case. State - 16CF54 - waiver of PH and asks if any money posted to be transferred to 16CF54. No money has been posted. Richards has filed waiver of PH form for 16CF54. Court goes over form with defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Richards would like to proceed to ARGN, waives further reading of INFO and enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond - Richards does not object to the bond that was inplace for 16CF42, which was $10,000 cash. 16CF54 - Court orders $10,000 Cash bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
